intro: Faramea macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf faramea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in length. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically white or pale green in color. Faramea macrophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique growth habit.
